prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing congratulations greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

üé® CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clich√© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Hawaii ocean with fish and turtles 
New York 
San Francisco tech world

Make human 2 d and simple 
Silhouette 
No distinct facial features 

Stars
Navigating across the world

Eyes closed
Dreaming
Getting Visions

Keep it sparkly
Bright
Happy
Uplifting
Inspiring

Aqua ocean "
Style: üé® Watercolor
Tone: ‚ù§Ô∏è Heartfelt - sincere and emotional
To: Mele
From: Little mel
Message: "Mele

Sing your true song

Travel with your heart

Trust your heart "



CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front ‚Üí interior ‚Üí back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the sincere and emotional tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way








Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "congratulations" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). TEXT STYLE: Write the greeting text in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that matches the elegant style used inside the card - legible, flowing, and graceful with natural character and warmth. Create charming cartoon-style or stylized illustrated figures if people are needed for the theme. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a congratulations card with sincere and emotional tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "Mele

Sing your true song

Travel with your heart

Trust your heart " positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. HANDWRITING STYLE: Write the message in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal. The handwriting should be legible, flowing, and have natural character - not overly perfect but graceful and warm. Use a nice pen-style appearance with natural ink flow and slight variations in line weight. Think of sophisticated calligraphy that's still approachable and easy to read. Make the handwriting feel genuine and heartfelt. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the handwritten message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clich√© designs and create something genuinely special! Use the elegant cursive handwriting style described above. Style: in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. IMPORTANT: Leave the bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) completely clear and undecorated - this space is reserved for a QR code. Focus decorative elements toward the center and left side of the design. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in watercolor painting style, with soft flowing colors, artistic brush strokes, paper texture, and organic paint bleeds

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover: Front cover of a greeting card with a 9:16 aspect ratio, in a watercolor painting style. The scene depicts a tranquil beach at dusk. A solitary, simple, 2D silhouette of a young person with eyes closed, facing upwards, stands on the shore, looking towards the sky. The sky is a gradient of deep blue transitioning into vibrant pinks and purples, speckled with numerous bright white stars and subtle constellations. A gentle, sparkling ocean with soft waves fills the lower half of the image, rendered in various shades of aqua blue with white highlights. Three glowing, stylized sea turtles are depicted swimming in the shallow water near the shore. The word "Congratulations" is written in elegant, white, handwritten cursive script across the upper portion of the sky, positioned safely within the central area. The overall mood is peaceful, inspiring, and dreamlike, with a sparkling and uplifting atmosphere.
generatedPrompts.backCover: Back cover design for a greeting card with a watercolor painting style, featuring a soft, gradient wash of deep to light blues that fades into white in the lower right corner. At the top center, a stylized, white, sparkling compass rose is depicted, with a delicate trail of small, scattered white sparkles forming a circular path around it, suggesting navigation and magic. The overall impression is peaceful, serene, and subtly inspiring, with ample empty space in the bottom right for a QR code, keeping the decorative elements primarily in the upper and central areas. The artistic style is consistent with a watercolor painting, characterized by soft brushstrokes, organic color blends, and a subtle paper texture, creating a cohesive and emotionally resonant conclusion to a visual story.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a greeting card with a watercolor painting style, depicting a serene aquatic scene transitioning into a vibrant cityscape. The top third of the image features a stylized, dark blue silhouette of a New York-like city skyline against a deep, speckled night sky with twinkling, sparse white dots suggesting stars or gentle snowfall. Below this urban silhouette, a wide expanse of aqua-colored ocean dominates the middle section, rendered with flowing, wavy brushstrokes and soft color gradients of turquoise and teal. A subtle golden shimmer weaves through the waves, and a school of small, simple, silhouette-style fish swim in formation towards the right. The bottom third of the image reveals a San Francisco-inspired cityscape silhouette, with a prominent bridge and rolling hills in the background. This lower cityscape is rendered in muted teal tones, overlaying a network of glowing, thin golden lines that represent technology and data flow. These lines connect minimalist icons: a cogwheel, a starburst symbol, a lightbulb, a simple computer monitor, and upward-trending graph lines, all outlined in thin, bright gold. The overall color palette is cohesive, with deep blues, bright aquas, and golden highlights, creating an uplifting and inspiring mood. The artistic style emphasizes soft watercolor textures, visible brush strokes, and organic paint bleeds, all contributing to a heartfelt and emotional tone. The composition is designed for a 9:16 aspect ratio, with a full-bleed background. There is no text or people on this interior page.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with a watercolor painting style. The background is a serene, ethereal blend of aqua and teal watercolors with soft, flowing brushstrokes and subtle paper texture. Emerging from the top left is a beautiful, stylized sea turtle, rendered in shades of turquoise and teal, with a delicate gold constellation pattern on its shell. A shimmering trail of gold glitter and stardust follows the turtle, curving gently towards the center of the page. The handwritten message, "Mele Sing your true song Travel with your heart Trust your heart", is elegantly presented in a flowing, cursive script in a deep teal or dark green ink. The text is positioned to the right of the turtle, with "Mele" at the top, and the subsequent lines centered and stacked below. The overall composition is uplifting, inspiring, and heartfelt, with the sparkly gold elements adding a touch of magic and wonder. The art style is consistent with soft watercolor washes, visible brushwork, and organic paint bleeds, creating a cohesive and dreamlike atmosphere. The prompt should incorporate these elements with a focus on the specific arrangement and artistic rendering of the turtle, the shimmering golden accents, and the placement and style of the handwritten message, all within the specified watercolor aesthetic.
